meanings.definition: An exclamation of disappointment or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Shucks! I dropped my ice cream.
meanings.sent2: Oh shucks, I forgot my homework at home.
meanings.sent3: Shucks, I missed the bus again!
meanings.sent4: Shucks, the rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: Shucks, I burnt the cookies I was baking.

meanings.definition: To remove the outer covering or shell from (such as corn).
meanings.sent1: She carefully shucks the corn before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: Farmers shuck corn to prepare it for sale.
meanings.sent3: He shucks the corn with ease, having done it many times before.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully shucks the oysters for the dish.
meanings.sent5: The children love to help shuck peas for dinner.

meanings.definition: To discard or reject something as unimportant or worthless.
meanings.sent1: He decided to shuck the old clothes he never wore.
meanings.sent2: She shucks the idea of going to the movies tonight.
meanings.sent3: They shuck the broken toy into the trash.
meanings.sent4: The company will shuck the outdated technology for newer models.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will shuck the incorrect answers from the test.
